channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Inside the story that enraged OpenAI
item.description: In 2019, Karen Hao, a senior reporter with MIT Technology Review, pitched me on writing a story about a then little-known company, OpenAI. It was her ...

item.title: My ex-wife said she should have been compensated for working part time during our divorce 20 years ago. Do I owe her?
item.description: “My ex-wife and I both recently retired from federal government jobs, and have comfortable retirements.”

item.title: My father’s widow keeps sending me $200 checks in the mail. Why would she do this?
item.description: “I sent a ‘thank you’ card and asked what it was for, but I got no answer.”

item.title: Nvidia powers world’s largest quantum research supercomputer
item.description: Nvidia announced the opening of the Global Research and Development Center for Business by Quantum-AI Technology.

item.title: This veteran investor crunches the numbers and sees the risk of a full-blown bear market
item.description: Kotok in his latest email to clients walks through an estimate of just how much tariffs will take a bite out of corporate earnings.

item.title: ‘I’m an idiot’: I’m middle aged, earn $68,000 a year and have $39,000 in credit-card debt
item.description: “I plan on keeping the accounts open to protect my credit, but I will cut and toss all the cards so I can’t use them.”

item.title: Nvidia provides Omniverse Blueprint for AI factory digital twins
item.description: Nvidia today announced a significant expansion of the Nvidia Omniverse Blueprint for AI factory digital twins, now available as a preview.

item.title: Nvidia launches AI-first DGX Personal Computing Systems
item.description: Nvidia announced that Taiwan’s leading system manufacturers are set to build Nvidia DGX Spark and DGX Station systems.

item.title: Nvidia-powered supercomputer to enable quantum leap for Taiwan’s research
item.description: Nvidia is powering a supercomputer at Taiwan’s National Center for High-Performance Computing that’s set to deliver over eight times more AI performan...

item.title: Why the U.S. consumer may be more resilient than many think
item.description: The U.S. consumer may have more resilience to the onslaught of tariffs than many assume.

item.title: Can crowdsourced fact-checking curb misinformation on social media?
item.description: In a 2019 speech at Georgetown University, Mark Zuckerberg famously declared that he didn’t want Facebook to be an “arbiter of truth.” And yet, in the...

item.title: NVIDIA releases cloud-to-robot computing platforms for physical AI, humanoid development
item.description: New NVIDIA Isaac GR00T humanoid models will be available on Hugging Face, and RTX PRO 6000 Blackwell workstations and RTX PRO servers can accelerate s...

item.title: Foxconn builds AI factory in partnership with Taiwan and Nvidia
item.description: Nvidia and Foxconn announced they are working with the Taiwan government to build an AI factory supercomputer.

item.title: NVIDIA accepts Ekso Bionics into its Connect program
item.description: NVIDIA Connect brings together emerging and established technology companies such as Ekso to accelerate product development. The post NVIDIA accepts E...

item.title: RealMan displays embodied robotics at Automate 2025
item.description: RealMan Robotics debuted AI-powered robotic arms and modular platforms, highlighting innovations for manufacturing, research, and healthcare. The post...

item.title: Persona AI raises $27M to develop humanoid robots for shipyards
item.description: Persona AI said it has already signed an agreement with HD Hyundai to deploy humanoid robots into shipyards. The post Persona AI raises $27M to develo...

item.title: ABB deploys PixelPaint at Mercedes-Benz plant in Germany
item.description: ABB said the painting system is both sustainable and resource-saving, and it began operating in the Mercedes facility earlier this year. The post ABB ...

item.title: Access to experimental medical treatments is expanding across the US

item.title: This baby boy was treated with the first personalized gene-editing drug
item.description: Doctors say they constructed a bespoke gene-editing treatment in less than seven months and used it to treat a baby with a deadly metabolic condition....
